title: NOT Frutiger Next, Camphor, Motiva, or Proxima Nova. But close.
content:
We are getting a logo redesigned, and when we asked the designer what font he used, he said "Untitled Regular" and attached a font file with nothing in it. This should have been a warning.

I got him to send a screenshot of the font page, and have attached that, but I have already tried Identifont, WhatTheFont, and any other font things I could find.

After going through Identifont's "similar fonts", I have gotten this far:  
It is not Camphor, but that's the closest I could find - the numbers are all wrong, and I think the font is thinner than Camphor.  
It is not Frutiger Next - the j is rounder, the dots are round not square, the N might be wider, and the numbers don't match.  
It is not Motiva - the ends of the C's are flat, not angled, and the numbers don't match.  
It is not Proxima Nova - the numbers again, and also the shape of the lowercase a.

Stumped. Stumped stumped stumped. If we get no answer, I am not sure what to do - request a different font on the logo? I am 98% sure the designer does not know what font it is. But we like the logo in the end.

THANK YOU!  
Sheri Cheng (new member and font-o-phile)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419022257im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Mystery%20Font-1379442415_5681.jpg)

Font: 

 Segoe WP Light/Segoe UI Light v.5.27 

Solved By: 

 [Bendy](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419022257/http:/typophile.com/user/20652 "View user profile.")
author: sheriann13

comments.content: Yeah, it's not that either, as the 1 is different in the numbers, but that is another close option that I might be able to ask the designer to use instead.
Sorry, it's in fact Segoe WP. I think they may have also updated Segoe UI for Windows 8, to match the WP version.
Sorry, it's in fact Segoe WP. I think they may have also updated Segoe UI for Windows 8, to match the WP version.
